definition: to foreordain/to be bound to/to be destined to/to be doomed to/inevitably
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.chinese: 科託娃是註定成就卓越的。

sentences.english: Sometimes you can almost see the plan.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，你似乎可以知道哪些冥冥之中的註定。

sentences.english: If two people are meant to be together , eventually they ' ll find their wat back.
sentences.chinese: 如果兩個人註定在一起，他們總會找到重溫舊路的夢。

sentences.english: Some of you are bound to have met with disappointment in the recruiting season.
sentences.chinese: 在招聘季節中，你們當中有的人註定要與失望爲伍。

sentences.english: It falls to the young girl's lot to marry this old man.
sentences.chinese: 嫁給這個老頭是這個女孩命裏註定的。

sentences.english: They were destined never to meet again.
sentences.chinese: 命運註定他們永不再相逢。

sentences.english: Jenny is destined to be a loser.
In the area of WAP, smart phones are meant to be the winner of terminals.
sentences.chinese: 無線互聯時代，智能手機註定成爲新的終端王者。

sentences.english: Only then could the cement wall collapse in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 在當時，正是這一點註定了柏林牆的倒塌。

sentences.english: Any action is bound to merely increase antipathy against the 'Satanic west'.
sentences.chinese: 任何行動都註定只能增加對所謂‘邪惡西方’的憎恨。

sentences.english: Permanent cells have left the cell cycle and are destined to senesce and die.
sentences.chinese: 永久性細胞已脫離細胞週期，註定要衰老和死亡。

sentences.english: Still, you're not doomed to toss and turn night after night.
sentences.chinese: 然而，你並非註定要夜夜輾轉反側。

sentences.english: Farrell's career in law was probably doomed before it began.
sentences.chinese: 法雷爾的法律生涯還沒開始就註定是個悲劇。

sentences.english: What do the middleaged women need in order to maintain their youth and doomed decrepitude ?
sentences.chinese: 什麼是中年婦女的需要，以維持其青年和註定衰老？

sentences.english: He is the de jure owner of the property.
sentences.chinese: 他是財產的註定所有權人。

sentences.english: We sre doomed to be meet together on the travel.
sentences.chinese: 涐們註定湜相遇旳旅亼。

definition: in the end/after all is said and done
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
fate or chance that brings people together/predestined affinity or relationship/(Budd.) destiny
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
